channel.title: love on The Outsider's Journey
channel.description: Recent content in love on The Outsider's Journey

item.title: Feel good links
item.description: I’d like to share here some of the interesting links I’ve read recently: This one is the less covered story about ordinary and good Indian men.

item.title: The only way forward
item.description: I tend to avoid the news when I can. It upsets me and since I can’t do much about most of those issues far away I satisfy myself by trying to live in the best way I can; compassionately, sincerely and respectfully.

item.title: Kaalamellam Kadhal Vazhga: Lyrics and Translation
item.description: One of my readers requested a translation of this. Makes me happy that she asked! **kaalamelaam kaadhal vaazhga kaadhalenum vaedham vaazhga kaadhalae nimmadhi kanavugalae adhan sannidhi

item.title: The Risks involved in Love and Babies
item.description: I lead a straightforward and simple life. I work, have light conversations with my colleagues during lunch, come back to my flat, cook, hang out with my flatmates or other friends, read, sing, Skype with family and friends in other countries, and watch series like Star Trek and Grey’s Anatomy.

item.title: Fair is not Lovely
item.description: Dear Women of India, I hope you will soon learn to laugh at the ads which endorse the notion that having lighter brown skin makes you more beautiful than you are already.

item.title: Fire 1996: Exploring Lesbianism in the controversial contexts of Feminism, Religion and Sexuality
item.description: This bold movie tells the story of two women who are married to brothers in a joint family. Through shared loneliness, they soon start a secret affair within the household.

item.title: Adult
item.description: 25th May 2007 I suddenly realize I am a machine. I do the same things everyday. I’ve stopped feeling. I’ve stopped thinking. I’m too busy with my life.

item.title: The Woman
item.description: She is the wind you cannot capture, the fire you cannot hold, She has the strength of the earth but she flows She is a woman.

item.title: Written in the moonlight
item.description: From May 2008 For too long I have absorbed. Here in this moonlight. I still see colour. I breathe. I create. There is no romantic breeze

item.title: Our part in world violence (Tibet)
item.description: From May 11, 2008 Violence and aggression rise from fear and greed. What gives the Chinese the right to violate human rights? To kill and torture people?

item.title: God and Love
item.description: From April 2008: Words like love and god are of the most ambiguous. What do people mean when they ask ‘do you believe in god’ or say ‘I love you’.

item.title: Uyire en Uyire: Lyrics and Translation
item.description: For a change, this is a more recent song. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7qMTUVkahjU **M: Uyire en uyire ennavo nadakuthadi Adada intha nodi valvil inikuthadi Oh oru nimidam oru nimidam enai nie piriyathe

item.title: Kaadhalin Deepam – Lyrics and Translation
item.description: This is a melodious potential Ohrwurm which describes how he is falling in love. As it seems to be typical of the time period in which this movie was made, the choreography is weird, their expressions seem more contemplative or sad than joyful and the costume design is odd but the song sounds good.

item.title: Android body vs Human body
item.description: A lot of futuristic science fiction puts forward several ideas of what an android would be like. Data from Star Trek (TNG) is an intriguing character who tries very hard to understand what it is to be human.

item.title: Arranged Marriage
item.description: Arranged marriage is an old concept. It existed long before people accepted love (that occurred before marriage) as a valid reason to marry. The process through which this changed is reflected very well in the movie ‘Fiddler on the Roof’.

item.title: Oraayiram Paarvayile Lyrics and Translation
item.description: I’ve always found this song very hauntingly romantic. **Nooru murai piranthaalum nooru murai iranthaalum Unai pirinthu vegu thooram naan oru naalum povathillai Ulagaththin kanngalile uruvangal marainthaalum

item.title: Types of Love: An Analysis.
item.description: It is perhaps important to differentiate the various meaning that we refer to when we say the word love. Often ‘love’ is used in the place of a more suitable word.

item.title: Pure White Snow
item.description: Winter so beautiful I renew what I knew Feel pure white snow Fresh and cold, it swirls What colour is love? What temperature is it?

item.title: Ode to the Apple
item.description: Oh, Symbol of material Love, The ‘Apple’ of my eye, Your cold, mountain fragrance, Red beauty, Temptation, You are the reason for life, Knowledge, for the world’s Material existence and Humanity’s distance from god.
